title: gRPC panicked! error=runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description The beacon node has been running for some time and then started to produce error messages repeating each 12 second. See bellow for the error message and stacktrace. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? not sure ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction i don't know how to reproduce it ## üî• Error 

ERROR gRPC panicked! error=runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference stack=goroutine 5172485 [running]:

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Distribution:      Clear Linux OS
Installed version: 33620

Docker version 19.03.8, build afacb8b7f0d8d4f9d2a8e8736e9c993e672b41f3
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:v1.0.0-alpha.23
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

I possibly observe the same or similar bug. Found it after eth2stats started crashing repeatedly. 

Node is running great and returning all other kind of gRPC request, except `/eth/v1alpha1/node/peers`

```
curl -s -X GET "http://localhost:3500/eth/v1alpha1/node/peers" -H "accept: application/json"
{
"error":"runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference",
"code":2,
"message":"runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference",
"details":[]
}
```

and at the same time in the node : 

```
[2020-08-19 16:17:40] ERROR gRPC panicked! error=runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference stack=goroutine 111056304 [running]:
```

The node is running 700+ peers
Thank you for reporting! @prestonvanloon do you know what the source could be for this bug?
Something to do with the list peers debug endpoint. Let's have @nisdas take a look as the original owner of that code.
Just posting to say that I'm seeing this in alpha.24 as well.  Running with `max-peers` set to 1000.
